summary.purpose: Defines global-scope enumeration types representing domain-wide status, category, and configuration values shared across all platform services.
summary.problem_solved: Provides a single authoritative source for system-wide status codes, localisation options, and entity type identifiers, ensuring consistency across backend services, frontends, and mobile apps.

exports.name: DefaultClient
exports.description_one_line: Default client identifier strings for standard and camera-installation contexts

exports.name: BoardStatus
exports.description_one_line: Numeric lifecycle status codes for GPS/telematics hardware boards

exports.name: EquipmentStatus
exports.description_one_line: String status values for peripheral equipment items

exports.name: EquipmentStatusReason
exports.description_one_line: String reason codes explaining the current equipment status

exports.name: UnitStatus
exports.description_one_line: Numeric lifecycle status codes for installed vehicle tracking units

exports.name: ClientStatus
exports.description_one_line: String status values for client account lifecycle states

exports.name: LanguageOptions
exports.description_one_line: ISO 639-1 language codes supported by the platform UI

exports.name: CountryOptions
exports.description_one_line: Country codes supported for client account configuration

exports.name: SiteType
exports.description_one_line: Hierarchical site type identifiers used in the organisational tree

symbols.name: DefaultClient
symbols.description_one_line: Default client identifier strings for standard and camera-installation contexts

details.what_it_does: Provides named string constants for the default client identifier used when no specific client is selected. Both members (default and camera_installation) resolve to the string 'akeyless', indicating a single shared default client slug for both contexts.

minimal_correct.title: Use DefaultClient as a fallback client identifier

symbols.name: BoardStatus
symbols.description_one_line: Numeric lifecycle status codes for GPS/telematics hardware boards

details.what_it_does: Defines four numeric states a hardware board can occupy: ReadyForInstallation (1), Installed (2), Malfunction (3), and NoSim (4). Used by board-management services and installer apps to track the physical board lifecycle.

minimal_correct.title: Filter boards that are ready for installation

symbols.name: EquipmentStatus
symbols.description_one_line: String status values for peripheral equipment items

details.what_it_does: Provides three string status values for peripheral equipment: Ready ('ready'), InUse ('in_use'), and Malfunction ('malfunction'). Used by the equipment management module to reflect the current operational state of accessories like cameras and sensors.

minimal_correct.title: Check whether equipment is available for assignment

symbols.name: EquipmentStatusReason
symbols.description_one_line: String reason codes explaining the current equipment status

details.what_it_does: Provides six reason codes that classify why equipment has its current status: Kit, Installed, Broken, Lost, Defect, and New. Paired with EquipmentStatus to give a complete picture of equipment health and disposition in service workflows.

minimal_correct.title: Mark equipment as broken with reason

symbols.name: UnitStatus
symbols.description_one_line: Numeric lifecycle status codes for installed vehicle tracking units

details.what_it_does: Defines five numeric stages in a tracking unit's lifecycle: NewOrder (0), Installed (1), WaitingForService (2), InstalledButNotActive (3), and NewInstallation (4). Used on the Car entity's status field to track installation and activation progress.

minimal_correct.title: Check if a vehicle unit is fully installed and active

symbols.name: ClientStatus
symbols.description_one_line: String status values for client account lifecycle states

details.what_it_does: Defines three client account states: Active ('active'), Suspended ('suspended'), and Deleted ('deleted'). Used on the Client entity to determine whether the account is operational, temporarily blocked, or permanently removed.

minimal_correct.title: Guard API access for active clients only

symbols.name: LanguageOptions
symbols.description_one_line: ISO 639-1 language codes supported by the platform UI

details.what_it_does: Enumerates four supported UI language codes: He (Hebrew), En (English), Ru (Russian), and Th (Thai). These values drive locale selection in client-facing applications and are stored on Client entities.

returns.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code string.

minimal_correct.title: Set a client's preferred language

symbols.name: CountryOptions
symbols.description_one_line: Country codes supported for client account configuration

details.what_it_does: Enumerates three country codes: US ('us'), IL ('il'), and TH ('th'). Stored on Client entities to drive country-specific business rules, compliance requirements, and feature availability.

returns.description: A two-letter lowercase country code string.

minimal_correct.title: Create a client with country set to Israel

symbols.name: SiteType
symbols.description_one_line: Hierarchical site type identifiers used in the organisational tree

details.what_it_does: Defines six node types in the platform's organisational hierarchy: root, region, office, mobile_app_user, installation_site_root, and installation_site. These values classify Site entities within the tree and control which actions and views are available at each node level.

returns.description: A string identifier for the site's position in the organisational hierarchy.

minimal_correct.title: Create a root site node

extensive_correct.title: Filter sites by type for display purposes
